data.title: Behind Enemy Lines: Miami Heat forward Shane Battier
data.meta_description: Now in his 11th NBA season, Miami Heat forward Shane Battier has earned a reputation as a defensive stopper and a three-point threat. The former Duke University star twice has been named to the NBA All-Defensive second team and is a career .385 shooter from beyond the arc. At Duke, Battier was a first-team All-America selection and received several national player of the year honors after helping the Blue Devils win the 2001 NCAA championship. He was selected sixth overall by the Vancouver Grizzlies in the 2001 NBA Draft.
